metadata.title: CVE-2014-3219 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
fish before 2.1.1 allows local users to write to arbitrary files via asymlink attack on (1) /tmp/fishd.log.%s, (2) /tmp/.pac-cache.$USER, (3)/tmp/.yum-cache.$USER, or (4) /tmp/.rpm-cache.$USER.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fish package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
